page.title: 07Farming (1)
page.content: Of about 3O small - medium farms, most are dairy farms with herds of 70-l60 milkers and followers, mainly Friesian Guernsey, Hereford, Holstein. About 10 farms have herds of beef cattle, some also with a dairy herd; 6 or 7 farms are arable. A once arable farm now has 20 Connemara ponies on rough grassland being resown for permanent pasture; another has returned to beef. Several farmers bring in keeper sheep from the Kent or Romney marshes during winter months as sheep are light-footed on soft ground, graze and manure as they go and only need hay in snowy weather. There are two large pig farms (1700 and 1000 animals) which sell meat to Horsham, and two intensive broiler- house units of 75,000 birds. One farm has turkeys and pheasants and a game licence; another has a small flock of Jacob sheep. Two holdings keep bees.
